Articles.Content:
Inspired by kurtjmac's

video, i wanted to try this myself too.

So i created this

It has 14 extra fueltanks, flies fine with just 2 of the 5 engines, extra engines are just for takeoff.

Total Fuel it carryes is 6975l I made it to North pole with just the extra tanks, but i only flew in low atmosphere so it took way more fuel than it would if id flown higher up, i glided about 30km (i have a wreck there) before the start of North pole to about the middle of it, well with power at 1 and two engines on to have better controll.. glides really well imho... it might go around the world if carefull...need to test that =))

I have a bigger version of this, but due to issue of fps dropping to unplayable (im assuming because too much stuff on on the screen) and runway being way too short i cant fly it.

ps. i would attach the .craft but i dont have access. The suggested Pastebin just stores text, unless the .carft is just text i dont see how its supposed to work...

oh.. it does. http://pastebin.com/sQ6YFjZi just remove the .txt at the end of the file and all should be golden.

Edited September 9, 2012 by oskumo
Update
Do you really need so much? But it does look awesome.

I made it to the north pole only using 450L of jet fuel (the plane carried 600L), so I don't think you'll need such a large plane.

Edited September 5, 2012 by Giggleplex777

My Delta Glider-EX (three-person craft) made it to the north pole with half the fuel, and in half the time Kurt did. Like him however, it was a one way trip.

**Lol, first post! Pictures/descriptions coming soon along with Talos Aerospace.

Couldn't help myself but have a go too.

Did it in a shorter time, less fuel, all at 100%. 1 way trip.

Here is the Image!
Now that is a nice craft
